title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for answering "yes" and equating the values of the left- and right-hand limits

1 point is earned for the correct explanation involving limits

f is continuous at x = 3 because lim x→ 3 − f(x)= lim x→ 3 + f(x)=2. MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaaeaaaaaaaaa8 qadaWfqaqaaiGacYgacaGGPbGaaiyBaaWcbaGaamiEaiabgkziUkaa iodadaahaaadbeqaaiabgkHiTaaaaSqabaGccaWGMbGaaiikaiaadI hacaGGPaGaeyypa0ZaaCbeaeaaciGGSbGaaiyAaiaac2gaaSqaaiaa dIhacqGHsgIRcaaIZaWaaWbaaWqabeaacqGHRaWkaaaaleqaaOGaam OzaiaacIcacaWG4bGaaiykaiabg2da9iaaikdacaGGUaaaaa@4FC7@

Therefore, lim x→3 f(x)=2=f(3). title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for k ∫ 0 3 f(x)dx +k ∫ 3 5 f(x)dx MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4A54@ (where k≠0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=xfr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaam4AaiabgcMi5kaaicdaaaa@3966@ )

∫ 0 5 f(x)dx = ∫ 0 3 f(x)dx + ∫ 3 5 f(x)dx MathType@MTEF@5@5@@52BA@

1 point is earned for the correct antiderivative of x + 1

1 point is earned for the correct antiderivative of 5 - x

= 2 3 (x+1) 3 2 | 0 3 + ( 5x− 1 2 x 2 ) | 3 5 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4E5E@

=( 16 3 − 2 3 )+( 25 2 − 21 2 )= 20 3 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@49C3@

1 point is earned for the correct evaluation and answer

Average value: 1 5 ∫ 0 5 f(x)dx = 4 3 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4312@

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for the correct answer 2k = 3m + 2

Since g is continuous at x = 3, 2k = 3m + 2.

g ′ (x)={ k 2 x+1 for  0<x<3     m for  3<x<5 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaaeaaaaaaaaa8 qaceWGNbGbauaacaGGOaGaamiEaiaacMcacqGH9aqpdaGabaWdaeaa faqaaeGacaaabaWdbmaalaaabaGaam4AaaqaaiaaikdadaGcaaqaai aadIhacqGHRaWkcaaIXaaaleqaaaaaaOWdaeaapeGaaeOzaiaab+ga caqGYbGaaeiia8aacaaMe8+dbiaaicdacqGH8aapcaWG4bGaeyipaW JaaG4maaWdaeaacaqGGaGaaeiiaiaabccacaqGGaGaamyBaaqaa8qa caqGMbGaae4BaiaabkhacaqGGaWdaiaaysW7peGaaG4maiabgYda8i aadIhacqGH8aapcaaI1aaaaaGaay5Eaaaaaa@5724@

lim x→ 3 − g ′ (x)= k 4 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@43E6@ and lim x→ 3 + g ′ (x)=m MathType@MTEF@5@5@@430F@

1 point is earned for the correct answer k 4 =m MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3A09@

Since these two limits exist and g is differentiable at x = 3, the two limits are equal. Thus k 4 =m MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3A09@ .

1 point is earned for the correct values for k and m

8m = 3m + 2; m= 2 5  and k= 8 5 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@419D@
